No zero divisors.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_2} [self : CanonicallyOrderedCommSemiring α] {a b : α}, a * b = 0 → a = 0 ∨ b = 0
name: CanonicallyOrderedCommSemiring.eq_zero_or_eq_zero_of_mul_eq_zero
docString: No zero divisors.

A natural number is a divisor of another natural number if and only if it divides that number and the second number is non-zero.

type: ∀ {n m : ℕ}, n ∈ m.divisors ↔ n ∣ m ∧ m ≠ 0
name: Nat.mem_divisors
docString: A natural number is a divisor of another natural number if and only if it divides that number and the second number is non-zero.

This theorem asserts that if a small natural number 'b' is divisible by a larger natural number 'a', then the small number 'b' must be zero. In other words, no small natural number can be evenly divisible by a larger one, unless the small number is zero. This is a fundamental principle of number division in natural numbers.

type: ∀ {a b : ℕ}, a ∣ b → b < a → b = 0
name: Nat.eq_zero_of_dvd_of_lt
docString: This theorem asserts that if a small natural number 'b' is divisible by a larger natural number 'a', then the small number 'b' must be zero. In other words, no small natural number can be evenly divisible by a larger one, unless the small number is zero. This is a fundamental principle of number division in natural numbers.

Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

name: Nat.dvd_left_iff_eq
docString: Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors.

The theorem asserts that the set of proper divisors of a prime number is empty or, equivalently, that a prime number's only proper divisor is 1.

type: ∀ {p : ℕ}, p.Prime → p.properDivisors = {1}
name: Nat.Prime.properDivisors
docString: The theorem asserts that the set of proper divisors of a prime number is empty or, equivalently, that a prime number's only proper divisor is 1.

This theorem states that any natural number 'a' divides zero. In other words, for any given natural number, there exists another natural number such that when the former multiplies the latter, the result is zero. This is a standard property of division in mathematics represented in Lean 4.

name: Nat.dvd_zero
docString: This theorem states that any natural number 'a' divides zero. In other words, for any given natural number, there exists another natural number such that when the former multiplies the latter, the result is zero. This is a standard property of division in mathematics represented in Lean 4.

The only divisors of prime powers are prime powers.

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [dec_irr : (p : Associates α) → Decidable (Irreducible p)]
  [inst_1 : UniqueFactorizationMonoid α] [dec : DecidableEq α] [dec' : DecidableEq (Associates α)] {a p : Associates α},
  Irreducible p →
    ∀ [inst_2 : (n : ℕ) → Decidable (a ∣ p ^ n)] {n : ℕ} (h : a ∣ p ^ n),
      a = p ^ Nat.find (_ : ∃ n, (fun n => a ∣ p ^ n) n)
name: Associates.eq_pow_find_of_dvd_irreducible_pow
docString: The only divisors of prime powers are prime powers.

Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization

type: Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ≠ 0}
name: Nat.factorization_inj
docString: Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization

Greatest common divisor of a finite set

type:
{α : Type u_1} →
  {β : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Finset β → (β → α) → α
name: Finset.gcd
docString: Greatest common divisor of a finite set

An element a divides the sum a + b if and only if a divides b.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : Ring α] {a b : α}, a ∣ a + b ↔ a ∣ b
name: dvd_add_self_left
docString: An element a divides the sum a + b if and only if a divides b.

Nonzero divisors have nonzero valuation.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R]
  (v : IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum R) (x : ↥(nonZeroDivisors R)),
  IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.intValuationDef v ↑x ≠ 0
name: IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.int_valuation_ne_zero'
docString: Nonzero divisors have nonzero valuation.

The divisors of a product of natural numbers are the pointwise product of the divisors of the
factors.

type: ∀ (m n : ℕ), Nat.divisors (m * n) = Nat.divisors m * Nat.divisors n
name: Nat.divisors_mul
docString:
The divisors of a product of natural numbers are the pointwise product of the divisors of the
factors.

Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

type:
∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : IsDomain R] [inst_2 : IsDedekindDomain R]
  (v : IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum R) (x : ↥(nonZeroDivisors R)),
  0 < IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.intValuationDef v ↑x
name: IsDedekindDomain.HeightOneSpectrum.int_valuation_zero_le
docString: Nonzero divisors have valuation greater than zero.

An element a divides the sum b + a if and only if a divides b.

type: ∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : Ring α] {a b : α}, a ∣ b + a ↔ a ∣ b
name: dvd_add_self_right
docString: An element a divides the sum b + a if and only if a divides b.

Division of rational numbers. Note: `div a 0 = 0`.

type: ℚ → ℚ → ℚ
name: Rat.div
docString: Division of rational numbers. Note: `div a 0 = 0`.

The only numbers with empty prime factorization are `0` and `1`

type: ∀ (n : ℕ), Nat.factorization n = 0 ↔ n = 0 ∨ n = 1
name: Nat.factorization_eq_zero_iff'
docString: The only numbers with empty prime factorization are `0` and `1`

Dividing `a` by the result of dividing `a` by itself results in
`a` (whether or not `a` is zero).

type: ∀ {G₀ : Type u_3} [inst : GroupWithZero G₀] (a : G₀), a / (a / a) = a
name: div_div_self
docString:
Dividing `a` by the result of dividing `a` by itself results in
`a` (whether or not `a` is zero).

The supremum of the partition is `a`

type: ∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : Lattice α] [inst_1 : OrderBot α] {a : α} (self : Finpartition a), Finset.sup self.parts id = a
name: Finpartition.supParts
docString: The supremum of the partition is `a`

Dividing `a` by itself and then multiplying by itself results in `a`, whether or not `a` is
zero.

type: ∀ {G₀ : Type u_3} [inst : GroupWithZero G₀] (a : G₀), a / a * a = a
name: div_self_mul_self
docString:
Dividing `a` by itself and then multiplying by itself results in `a`, whether or not `a` is
zero.

The prime factors of a natural number as a finset.

type: ℕ → Finset ℕ
name: Nat.primeFactors
docString: The prime factors of a natural number as a finset.

The proposition that a sequence indexed by integers is a divisibility sequence.

type: {R : Type u} → [inst : CommRing R] → (ℤ → R) → Prop
name: IsDivSequence
docString: The proposition that a sequence indexed by integers is a divisibility sequence.

If a small natural number is divisible by a larger natural number,
the small number is zero.

type: ∀ {a b : ℕ}, a ∣ b → b < a → b = 0
name: Nat.eq_zero_of_dvd_of_lt
docString:
If a small natural number is divisible by a larger natural number,
the small number is zero.

Least common multiple of a finite set

type:
{α : Type u_1} →
  {β : Type u_2} → [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] → [inst : NormalizedGCDMonoid α] → Finset β → (β → α) → α
name: Finset.lcm
docString: Least common multiple of a finite set

The `a`'s are nonzero

type:
∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : Fintype α] {T : ℕ → ℝ} {g : ℝ → ℝ} {a b : α → ℝ} {r : α → ℕ → ℕ},
  AkraBazziRecurrence T g a b r → ∀ (i : α), 0 < a i
name: AkraBazziRecurrence.a_pos
docString: The `a`'s are nonzero
